Package fr.lirmm.chocominer.api.services.managers.im.declarative

Class IMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager

java.lang.Object
fr.lirmm.chocominer.api.services.managers.im.declarative.IMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConversionManagerInterface, MiningManagerInterface<ItemSet>
@Service public class IMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager extends Object implements MiningManagerInterface<ItemSet>, ConversionManagerInterface
Handles the conversion of declarative data mining requests to specialized data mining and handles the execution of the mining process.

  • Method Details

    • conversionIsPossible

      public boolean conversionIsPossible(ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest) throws UndefinedConstraintParameterException, InvocationTargetException, NotEnoughParametersException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Checks if a conversion from a type of data mining to another with the given ConstraintsRequest is possible.
      Specified by:
      conversionIsPossible in interface ConversionManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - The constraints request to be checked for conversion feasibility.
      Returns:
      True if the conversion is possible, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      UndefinedConstraintParameterException - If a needed parameter for the instantiation of a concrete constraint is undefined or missing.
      InvocationTargetException - If an error occurs while invoking methods during the conversion.
      NotEnoughParametersException - If there are not enough arguments provided for the instantiation of a concrete constraint.
      InstantiationException - If an error occurs during instantiation of conversion components.
      IllegalAccessException - If an error occurs due to illegal access during conversion.

    • convert

      public AbstractIMSolvingStrategy convert(List<ConstraintInterface> concreteConstraintList, List<APIConstraint> constraints) throws InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException, UndefinedConstraintParameterException, ConstraintsNotConvertableException
      Converts a list of declarative constraints to a specialized solving strategy.
      Parameters:
      concreteConstraintList - The list of concrete (declarative) constraints.
      constraints - The list of API constraints.
      Returns:
      The specialized solving strategy.
      Throws:
      InvocationTargetException - If an error occurs while invoking methods during conversion.
      IllegalAccessException - If an error occurs due to illegal access during conversion.
      UndefinedConstraintParameterException - If a needed parameter for the instantiation of a concrete constraint is undefined or missing.
      ConstraintsNotConvertableException - If the provided constraints are not convertible to specialized constraints.

    • run

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Solutions<ItemSet>> run(ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest, String filePath) throws UndefinedConstraintParameterException, InvocationTargetException, NotEnoughParametersException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IOException, ConstraintsNotConvertableException
      Executes a mining process based on the types of mining, the given constraints and file path.
      Specified by:
      run in interface MiningManagerInterface<ItemSet>
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - The request containing a list of constraints to be used for the mining process.
      filePath - The path to the file containing the transactions used in the mining process.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the solutions or outcomes of the mining process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file or resource.
      InstantiationException - If an error occurs during instantiation of mining components.
      UndefinedConstraintParameterException - If a needed parameter for the instantiation of a concrete constraint is undefined or missing.
      InvocationTargetException - If an error occurs while invoking methods during mining.
      NotEnoughParametersException - If there are not enough arguments provided for the instantiation of a concrete constraint.
      IllegalAccessException - If an error occurs due to illegal access during mining.
      ConstraintsNotConvertableException
